There's... no way I'm going back to Okasama, not when she never loved me, after everything she did. I don't want to be locked in the basement again... As a human, I was... weak, anyone could hurt me, I'd never be allowed to choose anything for myself. Small, weak, cursed children don't tend to have good lives. But as a reaper... I'm strong in the UG, much more than I would be as a human, and I can fly, and uses of imagination that look an awful lot like magic still exist. A world without magic, after experiencing one /with/... would be intolerable. It's where all my friends are, everyone who's ever been nice to me, all the good times I've ever had. An'... like, the downsides... I can't age? I haven't grown any in five years anyway, I was never really going to again. I can lead a relatively normal life, with school an' friends and libraries and going to the arcade, except for on Game Weeks, but those aren't every week or anything, and I can hide if things go wrong or are scary. I can still do everything I'd ever wanted to do in my future, but now I have friends, and power, and somewhere I belong. An' I don't mind having to kill people, though I'd rather do that than stand back passively and watch them die. I've been surrounded by death and ghosts and forced to accept it all my life... The Game was scary, but it was also fun, and I wanted to stay in it.
